lines.text: And Milo! I've told you again and again - *please* don't walk on the chickens!
Maybe you don't realize it, Milo, but this a major day for me, because... well, maybe you don't realize it, but this is the day I've become... a watchdog!
To keep up his spirits, he began singing a dog marching song.
Here comes the dog, strong and brave - woof! Here comes the dog, your life he...
[falls into a hole]
He then decided to skip the whole thing.

[after Sandra gives birth to their first puppy]
It's a boy! It's a boy! It's a boy!
Uh, Otis... you ran out a little too soon.
It's a litter! It's a litter!

The noise upstairs didn't disturb the dogs that slept in the barn. They could sleep through anything. But a lot of the other animals were awakened by all the scurrying overhead. Some of them just accepted it... some were pretty annoyed... and a few quietly plotted revenge.
Look what the blizzard blew in! You look hungry; how about some fish?
Okay, but not for me; for my puppies.
You have puppies? Me, too!
You have *what?*
I mean, uh, uh... kittens.
Naturally, the sight of a dog and a cat watching an egg brought the usual string of gawkers... and thrill-seekers.
Did you hear about Gloria?
Oh, the egg! So it finally happened! Is she staying at home with it or is she going back to work?
Just let your heart lead and your feet will follow, and we'll bound and leap like a gentle breeze. Bound and leap like a zephyr set free. Bound, and, of course, leap.
Otis resumed his search for Milo. He saw in the distance an animal that he thought might be helpful.

[singing and swimming in a creek]
Deeya-da da da dat da, deya-da datta da... Eeyo edata da, de do doo datta-da.
[Otis runs down the hill]
Eeya dat-datta da!
[continues singing, climbs out of creek]
Oh... ah! Gah...
[shakes water off]
Ooh, that's better.
[proceeds to jump in meadow]
Excuse me! I'm looking for a friend of mine!
I'm looking for, uh, someone to play with! Wanna race me across the stream, eh?
I haven't got time!
...Otis said, sensing that this fox wasn't going to be any great help.
Hey wait a second... What kind of animal are you anyway?
I'm a dog, of course.
How can you be a dog? You have no tail!
Otis was outraged.
I certainly do! Look!
[wags his tail]
Ha! You call that a tail? THIS is a tail! Ha ha ha!
[waves his tail wildly]
And with that, the fox jumped away laughing.

[smacking a bird on the head]
Hey! Your singing stinks! Will you quit it?
Milo reflected on the family he'd stayed with.
Geez... no wonder they call them *pigs!*

[observing Milo's attempt at fishing]
That cat has got to be kidding.

[taunting the bear in the drawers]
Wanna come in? I'll help you. I'll pull you in by your nose!
Want some more dinner? Remember, you're eating for eight now!
You're a strange-looking cat.
Oh, I'm not a cat; I'm a dog.
All right, a dog, I understand, but... deep down inside, we're all cats, right?
Milo started walking too close to the edge.
Milo, dear.
His mother called.

[as Milo falls]
That's not a good idea! Come back here, Milo!
She yelled.
Sometime later, during the last weeks of the long winter, Joyce was making preparations. The time was drawing near.

[about her soon-to-come babies]
You okay, Joyce? Want some more dinner? Remember, you're eating for eight now.
Milo... Milo, I think it's time.
Okay! Remember the way to breath?
[Joyce breathes deeply]
